concepts.name: Emotional Diffusive Control
concepts.description: Emotional diffusive control involves interaction effects between emotional arousal and reward signaling, contrasting with neutral diffusive control in decision-making systems.

concepts.name: Neuromodulator-Mediated Homeostasis
concepts.description: Neuromodulators (e.g., dopamine, serotonin) mediate the brain's diffusive homeostatic control system, linking emotional states to physiological regulation.

concepts.name: Complexity Reduction via Emotions
concepts.description: Emotions act as an intermediate layer to reduce policy space dimensionality, enabling efficient decision-making under real-world time constraints.

concepts.name: Life-Long Utility Maximization
concepts.description: The goal of cognitive systems to maximize long-term fitness (e.g., reproductive success), computationally infeasible without emotional intermediaries.

concepts.name: Synthetic Emotions
concepts.description: Proposed artificial implementations of emotional processes in computational systems to mimic biological emotional functions.

concepts.name: Emotional Motivational Drives
concepts.description: Emotionally-driven motivational forces that interact with diffusive control mechanisms to influence behavior and decision-making.

concepts.name: Diffusive Homeostatic Control
concepts.description: A brain-wide regulatory system using diffusive processes to maintain physiological and cognitive homeostasis, mediated by neuromodulators.

methods.name: Literature Review
methods.description: Systematic analysis of existing research to synthesize current understanding of emotions' functional roles in cognitive systems.
